title: Noida schools closed for classes up to 8 until further notice due to cold weather
text:

Noida schools closed for classes up to 8 until further notice due to cold weather
Noida Schools Closed: The Gautam Buddh Nagar administration has announced that all schools will remain closed for classes up to 8 until further order. Explore the Noida schools latest news here.
Noida: The Gautam Buddh Nagar administration has decided to suspend all the physical classes for classes till 8 in all the schools across the district. It has announced that the Noida schools will remain closed till further order. The decision was taken in view of the cold weather conditions.
District Basic Education Officer Rahul Panwar has issued an order stating that the school closure applies to all schools across board affiliations.
The official notice reads, “In compliance with the instructions given by the District Magistrate, Gautam Buddh Nagar, in view of the dense fog and extreme cold, there will be a holiday in all the schools (classes from nursery to 8) recognized by all the boards (CBSE / ICSE / IB, UP Board and others) operating in the district with immediate effect till further orders. The said order should be strictly followed.”
According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD, the mercury dipped below 10 degrees Celsius in Gautam Buddh Nagar on Thursday. It has also predicting foggy and misty condition. The Met has also predicted a low of 8 degrees Celsius on Friday.
The Uttar Pradesh Basic Education Department has announced the UP winter vacation 2025 for all schools in the state including Noida. All primary schools including private and government will remain closed till January 14 amid cold weather conditions. The schools will reopen on January 15, 2025.
